dcterms:creator: Nathan Silberman
Derek Hoiem
Pushmeet Kohli
Rob Fergus
dcterms:description: NYUV2 is an indoor dataset containing 120K RGB and depth pairs with a size of 480 Ã— 640 acquired as video sequences from 464 indoor scenes using a Microsoft Kinect. The dataset is used for evaluating monocular depth estimation methods.
dcterms:title: NYU Depth V2

dcterms:creator: Andreas Geiger
Philip Lenz
Christoph Stiller
Raquel Urtasun
dcterms:description: KITTI is an outdoor dataset that consists of stereo images and 3D scans from 61 scenes captured by multiple sensors mounted on top of a moving vehicle. It is widely used for evaluating depth estimation algorithms.
dcterms:title: KITTI

dcterms:creator: Shuran Song
Samuel P. Lichtenberg
Jianxiong Xiao
dcterms:description: SUNRGB-D is an indoor dataset collected using various sensors, comprising 10335 real RGB-D images of room scenes. It is used for evaluating scene understanding and depth estimation methods.
dcterms:title: SUNRGB-D
